AboutScreen.about_text:
"DaKanji" helps students of the Japanese language and people who use it.
"DaKanji" is available for, [iOS]({APPSTORE_PAGE}), [Android]({PLAYSTORE_PAGE}), [MacOS]({MACSTORE_PAGE}), [Linux (Snap)]({SNAPSTORE_PAGE}), [Windows]({MICROSOFT_STORE_PAGE}).
You can also find all releases on [GitHub.]({GITHUB_RELEASES_PAGE}).

Also check out [my other apps.]({DAAPPLAB_STORE_PAGE})
If you have problems using this app or suggestions on how to improve it please report them [here]({GITHUB_ISSUES}), join the [discord server]({DISCORD_SERVER}), or use the feedback menu to send an annotated screenshot.

The privacy policy can be found [here]({PRIVACY_POLICE})
AboutScreen.title: About

DictionaryScreen.title: Dictionary
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_begin_text: We will show you a quick tutorial to get you started.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_examples_tab: Lastly, the examples tabs shows you some example sentences that use the selected word.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_kanji_tab: The Kanji-tab includes information about the Kanjis used in the word. This includes number and order of strokes and meanings.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_search_input_clear_text: This button clears the input or copies the text from your clipboard.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_search_input_draw_text: This button opens a screen in which you can draw Kanjis to look them up quickly.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_search_input_text: This is the search input field, just tap on it to input any word you would like to search.
DictionaryScreen.tutorial_word_tab: This tab includes various information about the selected search result, such as conjugation and translations. The language of the translations can be chosen in the settings.
DictionaryScreen.word_conj_verb_causative_passive_m: Is [not] made / will [not] be made to do (by someone)
DictionaryScreen.word_conj_verb_conditional_m: If X were [not] to do, when X does [not] do
DictionaryScreen.word_conj_verb_potential_m: [Not] be able to do, can [not] do
DictionaryScreen.word_conj_verb_provisional_m: If X does [not do], if X is [not]

DrawScreen.title: Drawing
DrawScreen.tutorial_begin_text: We will show you a quick tutorial to get you started.
DrawScreen.tutorial_dictionary_settings: In the settings the translation service can be chosen
DrawScreen.tutorial_double_tap_prediction: A Double Tap adds the character to the search box
DrawScreen.tutorial_long_press_prediction: A long press opens the prediction in a dictionary
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search: Here you can search multiple characters at once
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search_double_tap: A double tap empties the field
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search_long_press: A long press opens the characters in a dictionary
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search_short_press: A short press copies the characters to the clipboard
DrawScreen.tutorial_multi_search_swipe_left: Swiping left on this field deletes the last character
DrawScreen.tutorial_predictions: The predicted characters will be shown here
DrawScreen.tutorial_short_press_prediction: A short press copies the prediction
DrawScreen.tutorial_undo: Press to undo the last stroke

FeedbackScreen.feedback_description_text: What's wrong? Annotate the view above and then press "submit".
FeedbackScreen.title: Feedback

HomeScreen.RatePopup_text:

If that is the case a rating would be awesome and it would help this project a lot!

ManualScreen.text_pos_i_adj: い-adjective: this is an い-adjective example.
ManualScreen.text_pos_intro: The meaning of the Part of Speech (POS) colors are:
ManualScreen.text_pos_na_adj: な-adjective: this is a な-adjective example.
ManualScreen.title: Manual

OnBoarding.Onboarding_1_text: Just draw it and "DaKanji" will show the character you need.
OnBoarding.Onboarding_1_title: You do not know a Kanji?
OnBoarding.Onboarding_2_text: With "DaKanji" you can quickly lookup words using the inbuilt dictionary or on the internet.
OnBoarding.Onboarding_3_text: Use DaKanji's text analysis tools to add furigana, spaces and more or translate the whole sentence.
OnBoarding.Onboarding_3_title: Do not know how to read a sentence?

SettingsScreen.draw_browser_for_online_dict: Use a webview for web dictionaries
SettingsScreen.misc_default_screen: Initial screen when starting the app
SettingsScreen.misc_window_on_top: Should the application always be on top of others
SettingsScreen.title: Settings

Stores.long_description:
You are learning Japanese? Then you need to give "DaKanji" a try!

Did you ever try to read a Japanese text but did not know how to read some Kanji? "DaKanji" is here to help you. Draw a Kanji and the app will convert it to a digital character. You do not even need to know the stroke order! Write characters and build words to then translate them, and all of that is completely offline.

Feature overview:
* Recognize 6500+ Kanji and all Kana offline
* Use web and app dictionaries to translate characters or words
Stores.mockup_1_1: Don't know a Kanji? Just draw it!
Stores.mockup_1_2: Even the stroke order doesn't matter.
Stores.short_description:
You are learning Japanese? Then you need to give "DaKanji" a try!
Find characters and translate them just by drawing.
Stores.shortest_description: You are learning Japanese? Then you need to give "DaKanji" a try!

TextScreen.title: Text
TextScreen.tutorial_begin_text: We will show you a quick tutorial to get you started.
TextScreen.tutorial_colors_text: This button shows the Part of Speech of words in different colors (the meanings of the colors can be seen in the manual).
TextScreen.tutorial_fullscreen_text: This button switches the processed text to full screen.
TextScreen.tutorial_furigana_text: This button adds furigana to the text.
TextScreen.tutorial_processed_text_double_tap: A double tap will select a sentence.
TextScreen.tutorial_processed_text_long_press: A long press will select a word and show the Part of Speech information.
TextScreen.tutorial_processed_text_tap: A single tap will select a word.
TextScreen.tutorial_processed_text_text: The processed text will be shown here. You can select parts of the text to look them up in the dictionary.
TextScreen.tutorial_processed_text_triple_tap: A triple tap will select a paragraph.
TextScreen.tutorial_spaces_text: With this button spaces are added to the text.
TextScreen.tutorial_text_input_text: Here you can write or paste any text. This text can be processed with different tools.
